definition:
Palpitations are perceived
abnormalities of the &%HeartBeat characterized by awareness of cardiac
muscle contractions in the chest, which is further characterized by
the hard, fast and/or irregular beatings of the &%Heart.[from
Wikipedia]
opposite_reasoning: HeartPalpitation is explicitly defined as an abnormality of the HeartBeat - fast, hard, irregular, and notably perceived. The most semantically coherent opposite is NormalHeartBeat, representing regular cardiac rhythm that operates below conscious awareness. This provides the clearest axis: abnormal/perceived vs. normal/unconscious cardiac activity. For Fisher-LDA, this creates a meaningful physiological state axis that would help distinguish between pathological and healthy cardiac manifestations. While it may not directly relate to AI safety monitoring for deception, it provides a clean medical symptom axis.
